results.title: Drums of Fu Manchu. Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: John English, William Witney and Republic Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Episodes eight to fifteen of this horror/action movie serial. The story line has Fu Manchu (Harry Brandon) in search of the tomb that houses the legendary sceptre of Genghis Khan. His oldest nemesis Sir Nayland Smith (William Royle) stands in his way and creates an adventure that spans from Asia to America. “And with him, comes the thunder of his summons to death -“

results.title: Drinking
results.creator_credit: Joe Licastro, Floyd Elliott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: By alternating live-action sequences and animated graphics, the film follows the behavioral and physiological transformations that are directly linked to consumption of alcohol. It shows the short-term and long-term effects on the human body.

results.title: Drummer Hoff
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel, William Snyder and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This film is a lively folk verse about the building of a cannon called the Sultan. Brightly dressed in full uniform, each soldier brings a part of the remarkable machine. Based on the book by Barbara and Ed Emberly.

results.title: Potter's Song: Art and philosophy of Paul Soldner
results.creator_credit: David Hubbard, Tom Hubbard, Dick Hoffman and Crystal Productions
results.brief_description: Explains the work and philosophy of ceramic artist and educator, Paul Soldner. Shows him demonstrating his techniques he has developed to create his non-functional raku pottery, and discussing the changing course of his ceramic art and its relationship to the environment.

results.title: Potatoes
results.creator_credit: Robert Lang, Roman Bittman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This documentary deals with the gradual shift from the family farm, to corporation-run farms, with all the ensuring problems and personal hardship. It is an incisive evaluation of what is happening in North America particularly St Johns Valley of New Brunswick and in world wide agriculture today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lang, Roman Bittman and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: This documentary deals with the gradual shift from the family farm, to corporation-run farms, with all the ensuring problems and personal hardship. It is an incisive evaluation of what is happening in North America particularly St Johns Valley of New Brunswick and in world wide agriculture today.

results.title: Postcard from Tunis
results.brief_description: The central theme of ‘Postcard from Tunis’ is writing itself - its histories, its inscriptions and its relevance to the human-computer interface. This is explored in a personal, audiovisual portrait of Tunis, the home of my family-in-law. I designed and programmed the unique interface so that it echoes an actual visit, where you can’t help learning a few Tunisian words and with time, starting to read written Arabic. Although the work was designed for adults, children have shown a strong affinity with it.

results.title: Poltergeist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tobe Hooper, Frank Marshall, Steven Spielberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The secure existence of an quintessentially middle-class nuclear family living in suburban California is shattered by supernatural forces in this updated haunted-house narrative produced by Spielberg in the same year he produced and directed “E.T.”. The youngest daughter, ten year old Carol Anne, is inextricably drawn to strange phenomenon that communicate via the family television and which eventually pull her through the screen into the spirit world. Though the film was directed by Tobe Hooper, it is widely considered to carry Spielburg’s trademark style in its setting, its childlike sense of wonder and horror, and its extensive use of scary special effects. Cast: Jobeth Williams, Craig T. Nelson, Beatrice Straight, Dominique Dunn, Oliver Robins, Heather O’Rourke. Written by Steven Spielberg, Michael Grais and Mark Victor. Music by Jerry Goldsmith.

results.title: Pollyanna
results.brief_description: Adapted from the popular story by Eleanor Parker. Pollyanna (Hayley Mills) glows as the little orphan girl who believes that “things are always better than they seem”. She manages to change the heart of an entire town including her Aunt Polly (Jane Wyman). Judged by the public and critics alike as one of Walt Disney’s finest achievements. Pollyanna is a celebration of life. Rated G.
